text.content: Camila works the night shift at a hospital in Bogotá.
Her schedule is from 9 p.m. to 5 a.m.
Sleeping during the day was hard, and she missed her friends’ parties.
After work, she goes to the gym.
Then, she practices sewing with her needle and thread.
One day, the hospital allowed employees to request a shift change.
Camila was excited and submitted her request.
Weeks later, her manager gave her a letter.
She asked why, and the manager explained that older employees needed the day shift more.
Their bones ached, and they were tired.
At first, Camila was mad, but she understood.
She realized she was young and could handle the night shift.
She decided to stay strong for her older coworkers.
